ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned about different theater techniques, actions, motives, non-traditional casting, self-tape development, and Stick, Ball, Veil and other strategies of approaching characters.
approaches to acting while performing mt songs
I learned so much about musical theater technique and history that can benefit me in a theatrical career. I also learned a lot about the industry.
I learned methods to approaching/working through various types of work, including songs and book scenes.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Professor MC is very kind and thoughtful, and she provides thorough feedback and comments when each students performs their songs. The techniques and sense of ensemble was also very strong. One difficulty I had with this course was the workload, which felt much more heavy on the writing end than the performing end than I had expected.

strengths: very warm instructor, very close classroom environment
weaknesses: papers are unnecessarily long, class can be better organized (would have preferred things be put on canvas rather than all in emails)

I took this course with Oliveras. The strength is Oliveras's teaching when we work on scenes or songs. The class is super productive in those moments.  The weakness is that there was a lot of extra writing, reflection, exercises and warmups during class that were very time consuming and not as helpful/applicable beyond the class. Unfortunately the nitty gritty work felt like 20% of what we did and everything else felt like 80%.
The class is amazing and so much fun. The one thing is that the syllabus could be clearer about what is expected from the reading responses.
The small class size makes it very engaging. I learned a lot through my own work, as well as watching others work. At times the class felt unorganized.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The dance call, end of class and beginning of class check-ins, and use of self-tape and live performance were all great

improve: sometimes we'd get no breaks so we'd just be sitting for 3 hrs straight looking at screens
success: when we took breaks
The virtual format gets tiring, but overall, it was super fun.

Working through songs over zoom was different, but still very effective and useful. Some classes were difficult, though, because it was three hours staring at a laptop. Being on zoom also limited how much movement we used.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would recommend this class to another student, but I would suggest that they make sure they can give their full attention and time to this class if they want to get the most of it. This definitely isnt a 5th class.
yes, prof MC is a wonderful teacher and knows so much

I took this course with Oliveras. It is great for people just getting started in musical theatre, or people wanting to dip their toes in. However, I'm not sure I would recommend it for people who have a good deal of experience. Oliveras is a great teacher when it comes to working on scenes and songs, but there was a lot of extra reflecting, writing, and other activities that took up a lot of time and weren't very useful for what we did in class. Plus, there were 9 people my semester and we were always pressed for time.
I would but it is very hard both in work and quantity of writing
Yes, please take this course, especially with Prof MC.
I would definitely recommend the class. Even people who aren't interested in performing learned a lot, because you learn how presenting yourself certain ways affects how people perceive you.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Watching musicals, guest speakers
We did some pre-tapes in addition to live Zoom performance
workshop format
N/A
none
